metadata.title: CVE-2015-0286 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The ASN1_TYPE_cmp function in crypto/asn1/a_type.c in OpenSSL before0.9.8zf, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0r, 1.0.1 before 1.0.1m, and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2adoes not properly perform boolean-type comparisons, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (invalid read operation andapplication crash) via a crafted X.509 certificate to an endpoint that usesthe certificate-verification feature.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0286` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.11
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.11').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
